update.description:
The GAZEBO_IP_WHITE_LIST is a comma separated list of IP addresses. Only IPs in this list will be accepted. Leaving this env var empty will accept connections from all IPs.

It's hard to write a test for this since it depends on multiple computers. You can test this yourself by running:

On one machine: `GAZEBO_IP_WHITE_LIST=<external_ip> gzserver`

On another machine: `GAZEBO_MASTER_URI=<external_ip>:11345 gzstats`
update.title: GAZEBO_IP_WHITE_LIST environment variable

content.raw:
How about also putting a comma at the front 

 `","+this->acceptConn->GetRemoteHostname()+","`
content.html:

update.description:
The GAZEBO_IP_WHITE_LIST is a comma separated list of IP addresses. Only IPs in this list will be accepted. Leaving this env var empty will accept connections from all IPs.

It's hard to write a test for this since it depends on multiple computers. You can test this yourself by running:

content.raw: just tested gzserver with a whitelist ip address that contains my laptop's ip as a substring. Connection was allowed when it should be refused
content.html: just tested gzserver with a whitelist ip address that contains my laptop's ip as a substring. Connection was allowed when it should be refused

content.raw: approved but then afterwards thought about a case where the whitelist may be vulnerable. Made an inline comment below.
content.html: approved but then afterwards thought about a case where the whitelist may be vulnerable. Made an inline comment below.

content.raw: what if `this->acceptConn->GetRemoteHostname()` returns 192.168.1.1 and whitelist has 192.168.1.11? will that allow the connection since 192.168.1.1 is a substring of 192.168.1.11?
content.html: what if this->acceptConn->GetRemoteHostname() returns 192.168.1.1 and whitelist has 192.168.1.11? will that allow the connection since 192.168.1.1 is a substring of 192.168.1.11?

content.raw: I've updated this with a merge from default, after the 1.7 to default merge.
content.html: I've updated this with a merge from default, after the 1.7 to default merge.

content.raw: I had a problem with ImagesView_TEST, but I believe this has been fixed in gazebo_1.7 so I made pull request #479 to merge gazebo_1.7 to default.
content.html: I had a problem with ImagesView_TEST, but I believe this has been fixed in gazebo_1.7 so I made pull request #479 to merge gazebo_1.7 to default.

content.raw: Tested it and it works for me. I'm running make test now.
content.html: Tested it and it works for me. I'm running make test now.

content.raw: Ohh, right. Good call. How about comma?
content.html: Ohh, right. Good call. How about comma?

content.raw: Thinking ahead to IPv6 support, since IPv6 addresses use colons, it might be better to use a different separation character. Probably not urgent, but I thought I'd mention it.
content.html: Thinking ahead to IPv6 support, since IPv6 addresses use colons, it might be better to use a different separation character. Probably not urgent, but I thought I'd mention it.
